channel.title: Monadical Blog Posts
channel.description: Here you can find our publications

item.title: Downswings and the Information Game
item.description: I often hear players say, “I hate that site. It’s completely rigged. I can never win there.” Perhaps those players simply ran bad at first on that site...

item.title: A Map of Computer Science Subfields
item.description: A map of all the subfields encompassed by computer science, with job titles commonly used to hire people in those areas.

item.title: Redux State-Sharing Approaches
item.description: When writing an app using Redux and React, you may run into the common problem of having to share state between multiple components in your app.

item.title: Two Approaches to Concurrent Write-Safety in Django
item.description: When dealing with Django models accessed by multiple people, you want a way to make sure two requests don’t perform writes at the same time.

item.title: Reconciling Templates and JS Components
item.description: The fundamental issue is that Django wants you to build up your pages using template fragments, and React wants to pull you into its world with JS components as the main building blocks.

item.title: An Explanation of Segwit and the Lighning Network
item.description: Segwit increases total number of bytes for each transaction (very slightly), but changes the way that block size is calculated so that the signatures don’t count as much against the limit.

item.title: The Redux Store as the Frontend's Database
item.description: Storing data in a normalized form allows us to calculate fast indexes for lookups.

item.title: The Full-Stack Developer Checklist
item.description: A checklist of things for full-stack developers to strive to learn, spanning everything front frontend, to backend, to native development and devops.

item.title: The Myth of Trustlessness
item.description: The word “trustless” implies that trust has been removed from the system altogether. But in reality, systems like Bitcoin require plenty of trust, it's just less obvious.

item.title: Database Integrity Principles for Safe Systems
item.description: Design strategies and common pitfalls that come into play when designing a banking service to handle concurrent transactions in a distributed environment.

item.title: The State of Poker Platforms in 2018
item.description: An overview of the all the current online Poker networks as of 2018, with pros and cons for each and a summary of features.

item.title: We’re Building A Company, Not An ICO
item.description: A frank discussion about the benefits and pitfalls of the ICO hype, and why Monadical' vision goes far beyond short-term fundraising.

item.title: A Strategy for Linearizing Database Operations
item.description: Everyone wants their writes strictly ordered, if we can represent a list of write operations as a data structure, that gets easier.

item.title: Server Provisioning and the /opt Directory
item.description: An overview of how we provision and organize code and data on servers using the UNIX /opt directory.

item.title: Cleaner JS Animation Architecture With Functional Declarative Patterns
item.description: As systems get more complex, they trend towards expressing more of their complexity as data. Animations can be defined in data too.

item.title: Security Breach Response Guidelines
item.description: What should you do if your company gets hacked? What are the things to avoid and what are the procedures to follow? We explore the whole process in this post.

item.title: Easier Refactoring by Avoiding DRY Patterns
item.description: A short post about a particularly nice pattern for future refactorers that breaks the Don't-Repeat-Yourself principle commonly taught to beginners.

item.title: Monadical Applicant Study Guide
item.description: A list of documentation, resources, and example projects for potential applicants who are thinking about joining Monadical.

item.title: Our Favorite Technical Blogs
item.description: A list of our favorite technical blogs by friends, prominent programmers, and other companies we follow.

item.title: An Introduction to HTML and CSS Anatomy
item.description: A basic introduction and glossary for people learning HTML, CSS, and Javascript. Intended for people just getting started with frontend development.

item.title: Python Performance Profiling and Optimization
item.description: Modern techniques for performance profiling & optimization of Python applications.

item.title: A Postfix deployment postmortem: Debugging short-circuiting of mapping lookups
item.description: How we tracked down and fixed a bug caused by Postfix’s type:table using the new unionmap feature.

item.title: How to Make Remote Work: Part One
item.description: How to build asyncronous processes that enable you to work efficiently with a distributed engineering team.

item.title: How to Make Remote Work: Part Two, Zulip
item.description: How I've learned to be productive working from home. I'll write a second guide about how I think about remote work as a manager and the processes Monadical have put into place to make things work for us.

item.title: Monadical Principles Handbook
item.description: Our goal with this document is to share some of our knowledge and expertise around the process of working together as a team, in order to achieve a more efficient, happy and healthy working environment.

item.title: How to Fit All Human Knowledge in a Box
item.description: How we used the power of Cython to help streamline how knowledge can be packaged and accessed all over the world – even without the internet.

item.title: Why Open Source Projects Are Key to Innovation & Technology
item.description: Find out how open source projects are essential to innovation and the development of new technology.

item.title: The Year of the Linux Desktop
item.description: The year of the Linux desktop has arrived. This is a guide for how to improve the Linux desktop experience.

item.title: Unix System Monitoring and Diagnostic CLI Tools
item.description: An opinionated list of CLI utilities for monitoring and inspecting Linux/BSD systems.

item.title: How to set up a CI workflow
item.description: How to set up a basic CI workflow using GitHub and AWS, relying completely on managed services so you don’t increase your maintenance burden.

item.title: Why Everyone Should Know About Docker
item.description: What is Docker and how does it work? This introduction walks you through the benefits of this core technology and shows you how to get started with it.

item.title: Drone Mapping: How to Create Your Own Terrain Surface Model
item.description: An introduction to drone mapping. How to create a terrain surface model using a mobile app, your computer or cloud service, and your own drone.

item.title: How to Migrate from Firebase to Django
item.description: Strategy and tips on how to migrate from Firebase to Django (or another SQL ORM)

item.title: How COVID-19 will affect Outsourcing Trends
item.description: How the increase in remote work during COVID-19 will affect companies’ decisions on whether to outsource.

item.title: A Cheat Sheet for Using your JWT Authentication with Django
item.description: Getting DRF, SimpleJWT and Firebase to play nice.

item.title: How to Set Up a CI/CD Workflow, Part Two
item.description: In a previous article, I explained how to set up a pipeline to send images from GitHub to AWS ECR. In this article, I will focus on implementing the missing steps required for a fully functional CD pipeline.

item.title: Why should you use an ORM (Object Relational Mapper)?
item.description: Budding web developers learning Model-View-Controller frameworks are taught that they should use an Object Relational Mapper (ORM) to interface with their databases. But the “why” is often brushed aside or omitted entirely, leaving a fledgling programmer with burning questions like ”What are ORMs, anyway?”

item.title: How to Set Up a CI/CD Workflow, Part 3
item.description: CI/CD Workflow For a Flask App Using GitHub Actions and AWS ECS

item.title: Event Diven Architecture part 1
item.description: Lessons learned in building a poker platform using event-driven architecture, part one--the backend.

item.title: Oddslingers Open Source Announcement
item.description: The OddSlingers poker platform, built with python/django in the backend, and react/redux in the frontend, is now free and open source.

item.title: How to Build a Python Library
item.description: Share Developments and Contribute to the Community

item.title: How to Make Library Distribution Easier
item.description: A Manylinux-Based Web Building Platform

item.title: Implementing C++ Virtual Functions in Cython
item.description: This is an extensive article that assumes Cython knowledge and describes two strategies for using C++ code from Python, requiring the implementation of virtual functions in C++ abstract classes.

item.title: Drone Web Platform
item.description: A platform for operating drones through the internet.

item.title: Five Django Packages We Love at Monadical
item.description: One of the biggest draws to Django is its ecosystem. If you encounter a problem, the chances are that someone else in the community has too, and has been kind enough to abstract it into a package and release it. Here are five packages we find ourselves coming back to.

item.title: Cinco Paquetes de Django Que Amamos en Monadical
item.description: Uno de los mayores atractivos de Django es su ecosistema. Si se presenta algún problema existen muchas posibilidades de que alguien en la comunidad también lo haya tenido, y fuera tan amable de abstraerlo en un paquete reutilizable y publicarlo para la comunidad. Aquí encontrará cinco paquetes muy útiles que usamos con

item.title: Some Unofficial WireGuard Documentation
item.description: Some unofficial documentation for the WireGuard VPN, including config API reference, tutorials, examples, and projects. (This is a mirror of the original on Github)

item.title: Learning COBOL: A Journey For The Modern Programmer
item.description: A guide to learning COBOL for the modern programmer.

item.title: Python Packaging Guide for APT/Debian
item.description: A quick guide on how to package your Python/pip project into an apt-installable Debian package using stdeb.

item.title: All Systems are Human Systems
item.description: All systems in the field of software engineering are built by humans, to serve human purposes, and sometimes have broad but subtle influences in society and politics. It's in all of our best interests to to understand the broader, human scope that these systems operate within.

item.title: Starting and Running Your First Program on a Mainframe
item.description: How to run your first program on a mainframe using open source software.

item.title: How to Plot Mathematical Functions in 10 Lines of Python
item.description: How to build a mathematical functions plotter using Python, NumPy, SymPy, and Matplotlib.

item.title: Operator Overloading in Python
item.description: What is operator overloading and how does it work in Python?

item.title: The Rust Journey, Part 0: Why Systems Software and Why Rust?
item.description: Part 0 in our series about learning and writing systems software using Rust.

item.title: How to import your wallet to Solana CLI
item.description: Whether you’re looking to backup your wallet or deliver NFTs, importing your wallet is a great trick to have up your sleeve.

item.title: The Ins and Outs of Logging in Python, Part 1
item.description: A guide to using logging in Python. The fundamental concepts are discussed and illustrated with simple examples.

item.title: How to mint and reveal NFTs with Candy Machine V2
item.description: In this tutorial, you'll learn how to create a “mint and wait for reveal” Candy Machine. Doing so will allow Candy Machine users to mint “closed” NFTs and wait for them to be “revealed” at a later date, bringing elements of anticipation and excitement to their experience.

item.title: Technical solutions to tackle AI bias
item.description: Yes, we want more diverse workplaces but there are things on the computing side companies and developers can do to make AIs fairer.

item.title: How to setup a Wasm API for a CHIP-8 emulator
item.description: In this guide, you’ll learn how to keep control over the lifecycle of the library, allow signals/commands, and callbacks – all while keeping the asynchronous style that you know and love!

item.title: A how-to guide for OOP in Golang (for Python users)
item.description: I'll use an example scenario to demonstrate the features of the OOP model, show you how to implement the OPP model/principles in Python, and compare that to the implementation in Golang.

item.title: How math makes matches meaningful
item.description: In this blog, we show you how finding the right algorithm can make the difference when it comes to creating meaningful, professional connections virtually.

item.title: Building a FastAPI Server to Evaluate Mathematical Functions
item.description: We make an already-powerful program for plotting mathematical functions even better using three steps.
